text: * 8-bit water level music*
... oh, shit!.
*Electricity crackling*
- I am Raiden.
God of Thunder.
- Ok... I see, this means a new video just started...
...ah that's it yeah.
OMG YOU'RE RAIDEN THE THUNDER GOD!
THAT'S UNBELIEVABLE!!
- Yep.
- But where's your hammer?
- No, no, not *that* thunder god...
- I'm an Avenger, right?
Don't move.  I'm gonna go get my outfit.
... can I be Batman?
SILENCE!!
You have been chosen among the greatest warriors to take part
in the grand tournament that will restore BALANCE
in this world...
The
MORTAL KOMBAAAT
- The..the what?
- *Sigh*
The MORTAL KOMBAAAT
- The mortal what?
- You're doing that on purpose, aren't you?
- Yeah, a bit.
[Attic Gamer]
The Mortal Kombat takes place every year.
Every year, the champions of  Earth and of
the Outworld fight each other in a tournament of epic proportions.
We have been losing for nine years.
You're our last hope.
If we lose again this year, balance
will never be restored.
- What do you mean, "balance"?
- Look.
- The madness of men.
*Cheesy punching sounds*
- Bloody hell! That's Scorpio! One of Shang Tsung's fighters!
He too takes part in the MORTAL KOMBAAAT
- SHUT UP!
What I am supposed to do? I can't fight!
- Don't worry, you're the man!
*Raiden's move shout*
- I am ready to take on the champion... *sound becomes muffled and quiet*
- Oh my God!
- The tournament has begun, then.
The first step to get to the grand finals will be this game.
Let us proceed to the challenge location.
Is..is the name 'Scorpion'...uh...
...related to the astrological sign?
Fasten your seatbelts.
- Or is it because it stings?
- The Fifth Element. One of the most well known French films abroad.
Whether you like the movie or not,
visually, you'll have to admit, it's has a certain flair for the time.
Then again, the screenplay... ehhhh...
As a reminder, we're introduced to Korben, a taxi driver
who finds himself an unwilling participant in an typical quest
alongside Leeloo, the avatar of the element of Love...
in order to fight the evil Zorg...
and save the Earth from a killer planet launched by

the great enemy, namely,
EVIL.
*horror movie music*

There you go.
'Cause evil is no good... and love is stronger than evil.
It sure sounded better when I was 14.
But in the game, we don't give a fuck about all this stuff!
- Korben must infiltrate inside the Nucleolab
in order to find the cellular reconstruction lab. There, he must
reload Leeloo's materialisation process with the help
of the genetic pass.
- HE'S A TAXI DRIVER!
By the way, The Fifth Element
has become a joke among us, because
this game has been lying in a box since, like, 2011
and every time we push back the test.
BECAUSE IT SUCKS! IT GODDAMN SUCKS!!
- The first of you to finish the game will gain access
to the grand finals.
Let the tournament...
begin!
- OK! Well, if the goal is to save the Earth...
The game is a TPS where you get to play in turn as
Korben and Leeloo. Leeloo who, incidentally, has no name in this game.
For Korben, it's fine.
But for Leeloo we get the sound of a guy who nuts in his pants.
The main difference between characters
is that Korben uses guns, while Leeloo is more agile,

and can use some kind of magic.
And by "more agile" I just mean
she can get on all fours.
And, no, I won't joke about this.
Which results in some silly
game sequences, where Korben is completely stuck while Leeloo
can move through. *beep*
Yep, it's true. Clearly here...
... we need a better head.
- If only I had magical powers
and a nice ass, then, I could move through.
- Of course in this kind of test, the comparison with Tomb Raider,
published two years earlier, seem obvious: same kind of gameplay,
with the exception of jumps,
but paradoxically, the biggest fail in the game is also, for me, the most difficult to show,

and that's the controls.
The first thing you notice when playing the game,
is that Korben runs fast in straight lanes,
but, as soon as you want him to turn...
*sound of truck backing out*
It's fine!
It's not as if
turning around was something you use all the time--
I quit!!
Well, for a start, backhoe-motored fights sucks.
*whisper* Except in this wonderful fighting game of backhoe on PlayStation 2.
Moreover, of course, since we're on Playstation,
there had to be a fog-like shit soup blurring the enemies
not allowing you to see 20 meters ahead.
Take that!...

... vile... vapor!!
[there's an enemy there]
I'll tell you an anecdote: this kind of fog of war we see in old games
like these, it has a technical name which is called:
"I-had-no-time-to-optimise-the-game-engine, so-Ill-attach-a-smelly-old-plaster
so-that-it-doesnt-run-with-3FPS-and-still-publish-the-game".
And now, what's missing? Of course you know!
It's here! It's here on every Playstation game!
That smell of old, damp dog, it return every single time
and we never get tired of it!
NE-VER
The camera ♪
The camera ♪
is drunk and
out of control! ♪
The camera ♪
The camera ♪
turn around,
the enemy is not over THERE! ♪
I'll admit that Tomb Raider also had problems like that
with the aim, but the developers solved that, precisely, by making sure
that Lara always moves in spacious areas.
But here of course, since it's corridors, we have the classic problem of PS1's games,
a camera having a seizure every two minutes,
or starting to record your toes.
Thanks, great framing!
I love it.
Fuck, it's not hard though:
in a corridor, you place the camera behind,
and if the player turns around, you switch to the other side!
BUT YOU DON'T DO THIS!
By the way, this game adopts a lot a Tomb Raider features, but,
please, there's ONE thing I'm asking you not to adopt:
DO NOT MAKE THIS GAME INTO A MAZ-
THIS GAME IS A MAZE
FUCK!!
Of course, as if the fun wasn't constipated enough, The Fifth Element
tried to build on this Tomb Raider thing, with switches you have to activate,
which open doors on the other side of the level.
Except, in Tomb Raider, the camera moves to the door that just got opened.

So you see the path you have to take.
Or it's like you pass
near a door, and then you come upon the switch of the corresponding door.
Thus you know where the door is located.
It has a name, my darlings: it is called  "level design".
But, in this fucking game, it's like,
you come upon a switch...

you activate it...
you get a door-opening cinematic...
So what!? Why do you show me this?
I don't give fuck!

I don't have a clue where your shitty fucking door is!
I never pissed by it, and every wall looks the same!
This also has a name, dearests. This is called
Shit!
It is time, then, to switch to the other character:

this time, you'll control Leeloo.
*"nutting" sound*
Leeloo, being the incarnation of the element of love,
cannot fight with weapons, and is forced to fight hand to hand.
*Use of explosive grenades is allowed
as long as one proceeds with love. *explosion*
And the thing is, Leeloo struggles. She struggles like a judo white belt.
And while the game is deplorable with Korben, your weapon can still hit things.
When it comes to hand-to-hand, it's over!
You can't hit anything!
First enemy of the game with Leeloo.
*whoosh of missed attacks*
*Kids cheering*
The whole of Leeloo's combat system
is based on a broken gameplay, where you hit
one out of three times.
*sigh*
You know what's missing in the French video game scene?
It's a person like Gordon Ramsay or Philippe Etchebest.
- I have been a video game tester

for more than ten years.
And I've been through some turds.
Today, once more, I'll have to go to a
developing studio. I'm here to set things straight:

even if i have to be their worst nightmare.
STUDIO NIGHTMARE
WHAT DID I SAY ABOUT SEWER LEVELS?
WHAT DID I SAY?
WHAT'S BAD IN YOUR GAME?

- *sobbing* Hand-to-hand combat.
- AND HOW DOES LEELOO FIGHT IN YOUR GAME?
- Hand-to-hand.
Of course, since nobody thought about turning the game on before shitting it out in stores,
they also deemed good to put twice as many enemies - hence more fun -
... Wait, what about those enemies? Because, I mean,
if we ever have the technology to get robots flying, that's not something to do!
- Our next generation of police robots will be our ultimate weapon
to eradicate crime.
*robotic voice* Shoo! Get out! Fuck off!
*robotic voice* Shoo! Get out! Fuck off!
Fine.
I'll say something positive about this part:
when Leeloo walks, she wiggles her bum.
There you go. The camera doesn't work. The level design is complete garbage,
the game is as ugly as a wart and the combat is awful,

but...
- She wiggles her bum, doesn't she?!...
- Moreover, since the plot has no relation to the movie,
you don't even have the "pleasure" to see scenes from the movie.
Instead, you have every cliché you can think of from unimaginative developers,
such as those famous levels named "Factory".
You know, those classic factories that you see in video games,
with huge machinery and...
rivers of lava.
*loud machinery noises*
BY THE WAY, WHAT ARE YOU MAKING HERE?
- ACTUALLY, THIS IS A BISCUIT FACTORY!
- The levels' goal, then, will be first to find the "activators"
related to every elemental stone.
"Activators", that means, like, fire for the fire stone...

water for the water stone... and so on.
So, we'll be faced with levels
containing as much fun as a family dinner spent hearing about Granny's
neighbour stories, and as beautiful as if someone had taken a shit on my glasses,
all this just to find the air activator,
an element instrumental to our quest:
A FAN.
What!?
Do you have asthma?
'Cause even in this case, you know what would have worked too?
Doing THIS!
And of course, same thing for the rest: for the water element,
it is unacceptable to buy a bottle of Volvic
at the Arab grocer around the corner. No, that would be too simple.
Rather, let's make a looong level in an airport, with luggage belts,
you know, the luggage belts in the airport, with the presses that help crush the bags?

Hey, you know what could have also worked for the water element?
*clears throat*
And once you've collected every element activator,
now you have to collect the elemental stones!
Hell yeah! Let's extend the ride! You have entire levels
with platform sequences, still with that camera recording

everything but the platform!
I mean, what's this
camera angle for!?
I CAN'T SEE WHAT I'M JUMPING ON!!
Why are you inflicting this on me, goddammit?
Just do what you did in your fucking movie, shove the four elements up the singer's ass
and get off my cock!
What's even worse is that the levels are linked together through lame text
and a miserable scene from the movie. So that,
I don't even have to finish the game to know that
in the end, the only reward I get is seeing a scene from the movie.
Except, if you're playing The Fifth Element - The game, it means
you've ALREADY seen the movie!
SO WHY
AM I WASTING MY TIME?
- Hello, I'm the Devil's advocate.
This was to specify that this game's cinematics were edited
in a different order,
in order to offer something of an alternative story.
Which, in the end, gratifies the player with a never-before-seen experience.
Well then...
... I'll be going.
- Well, you know what? I'm too old for this shit.
I don't want to do the whole game, so, let's just
say he won. To hell with the "balance".
*gun shot*
Fuck. I really need to get this gun repaired.
- Congratulations, champion.
You won access to the grand finals.
- What do you mean!? I said I quit. He won!
Ah!
- We will then proceed to the location of the grand finals,
in the Outworld!
However, if you don't mind
I'll take this.
*exotic music*
- Welcome, champion of the Earth.
Welcome to...
Mortal Kombat!
Shangy!...

How have you been since last year?
- What about you? All well? Everything good?

No, in the Outworld we do four kisses.
- Sorry.
- You understand...
*chatter*
The champion of the Earth
has come to challenge us.
Who will rise to face him, and win the finals?
*exciting preparation music*
Thank you. First I'll ask you to make a TON of noise
for the champion of the Outworld, the ninja
from the cold,
are you warmed up
for SUB-ZERO?
*entrance music*

SUB-ZERO
Champion of the Outworld
- We look forward to a difficult game, my dear

Shang Tsung.
- Indeed, my dear Raiden, the champion
of the earth will need much courage to come back from
nine defeats in a row. Let's mention that
the winner will be able to restore balance,
as well as come home with a very fine TV-VHS multi-device,
as well as a two-year subscription to our partner, Télé Z. [cheap French TV programme]
Without further ado, my dear Raiden, we see that both challengers
take place in front of their machines. Tension is palpable.
I have a conviction this game will be memorable!
- Wait, it's too much pressure, I'm not sure I can make it...
- Take heart, champion of the Earth, you can do it.
MmmmmHmmm MhmmmHmm

- What's he...
- I don't...
- Don't worry, Sub-Zero. Keep a cool head.
Stay "cool"!
Cool as in... in English...
- What if I don't manage to restore the balance? What happens? All those golfers?
Snooker players?
- Calm down.
Everything will be fine. Imagine that you're home.
- OK. I imagine that I'm home.

I imagine that I'm home.
I imagine that I'm home...

Ah, great! This works just fine.
Quite practical too.
Alright. When we're speaking of fighting games, we immediately think of two great names of video games:
Street Fighter and...

- DEAD OR ALIVE!
I like boobs!
*slapping sound*

- Alright. Street Fighter and Mortal Kombat.
- But why don't you talk about Smash Bros.?
SHUT UP!
We've already briefly been through this franchise, through the movies,
in several "Hors-sujets", as well as the Mortal Kombat: Special Forces game,
a while ago. issued in 1992, Mortal Kombat was intended as the direct rival
to Street Fighter,
but with a realistic tone due to the use of digitised characters, as well as a conspicuous load
of violence - which, to be clear, was the only reason why you would play Mortal Kombat.
You won't make me believe it was played for its gameplay.
In any case, I'm not saying anything new
telling you that the Mortal Kombat games are,

almost exclusively, fighting games.
In 1997 however, Midway decides
to commission a game which will, this time, based on the character of
Sub-Zero, who had, rather unexpectedly, become a fan favorite.
Originally, he was supposed to be a villain.
Mortal Kombat Mythologies: Sub-Zero, appeared on N64 and PlayStation.
And this time, no more traditional fighting game.
We have a beat 'em up playable as a single player.
- You know, for a duel,
it would have been quite convenient to take a normal fighting game...
like... I dunno... Mortal Kombat?
Off the top of my head...

- A Mortal Kombat fighting game!?
- You've got to be kidding!
- We begin, then, with a definition of the word "mythology".
Yep. And to be clear: a "definition".
Like, it's not a quote from Plato, to bring in some style...
Nope. That's your definition from the Collins, that is,
"masculine noun...
singular, determinate", blah blah blah
Well, just from that you can guess what the editor
thinks people who buy Mortal Kombat games are like.
- *moron voice* Ughhh... Mortal Kombat! Where's the blood?
- As far as the story goes, the game is a prequel to the first MK game, where Sub-Zero is hired by a guy named
Quan-Chi to steal the map of elements.
*Road Runner sound*
- Umm... okay?
In short, the game is a pure beat 'em up in clear-cut fake 3D, since there is no notion of depth;
the graphics, which by the way are the same as for the fighting games,
that is, digitised characters, and...

*stomping sound*
Ughhh...
*Looney Tunes music*

*Windows boot sound*
(SECOND TRY)
As for the controls, they are exactly the same as the Mortal Kombat fighting games,

and that is one problem, because the controls...
*stomping sound*

FUCK YOURSELF!
WELL, since the game insists, we'll begin with that:
the hitboxes in this game are
FUCKED UP!
The pillars hit you from kilometers away!
Fuck! How does that hit me!? How?
Look, I could draw a line! It doesn't
even stroke my elbow!
WHAT FUCKERY!!
And this game does not miss one beat!

You also have the classic screen that is stuck on the wrong side! it's useless!
USEFUL || USELESS
Look, this empty space, I could build a flat in it!
Alright. I'll stay calm. I am Sub-Zero.

I am a ninja.
- That's not a ninja! Sub-Zero is a Chinese guy!
- I am a ninja from China.
Seriously, I have to make an aside,
but Sub-Zero is really a ninja from China.
Which is dumb. Because ninjas are Japanese.
Wait, there's even an official song named "Sub-Zero (Chinese Ninja Warrior)"!
Clearly, that was some first-class cultural reference.

- Yeah, I did a song about Asia
[author, composer, interpreter, heating specialist]

because I love that country.
*singing* The samurai of
the Great Wall...
do karate... against
Shaolin monks...
Jean-François François. Do not miss on his newest hits such as:

"Cantonais un ninja" [pun on Cantonese]
and "Seppuku trop violent" ["seppuku" sounds like "c'est beaucoup" (It's very violent)].
This album is already cancelled.
- Hi. It's the Devil's advocate again.
This was to point out that Sub-Zero is not really a ninja: in fact, he belongs to a Chinese clan...
*gun blast*
Fine then. Have a nice day.

- Back to it. We'll try to pass walking...
*stomping sound*
*buzzer*
Alright, we'll try running.
*double stomp, buzzer*
I'm fed up with these deaths! why does this moron fall back
every time he gets hit?
FU-CK!!!
I HATE HIM!
I HATE HIM!
WITH HIS CHEAP-ASS COSTUME
AND HIS DUMB FACE!
I WAS MORE AGILE WHEN I WEIGHED 150K!!
- No no, don't listen to him, you're handsome!
In fact, it's the whole logic of the game that's messed up.
For example, halfway through the level you arrive at a window,
when you jump...
*goofy scream*
you die.
When you jump from a window and die like trash
logically, as a player, you think, "that's the wrong way".
So, naturally you turn back and say "there's another way"
BUT NO!
The solution is actually here, it's just that you first have to jump onto this little railing...
wait for this little animation...
and then jump onto this overhang to rebound and land down below.
You know the rule of swan dives in games is for when you must jump onto something that's out of view.
But even this jump goes against the failed rule,
since normally, the swan dive is for you to jump as far as possible.
But here, no!
They succeeded in failing something failed!
- But failing something failed cancels out, amirite?
- In short, the first level ends with the famous duel between Scorpion and Sub-Zero.

*Overwatch music*
Their very first duel where Sub-Zero kills Scorpion for the first time and becomes his biggest enemy!
Go game! This is THE moment!
It's at this moment you know what to do for the people buying!
Show us violence!
SHOW US BLOOD!!!
*squeak*
I HATE MY JOB!
To fight enemies you have the same moves as the classic game
as well as special attacks that you unlock as you go, when killing enemies.
Sub-Zero's Ice Attack, for example
is quarter circle, cross. Easy.
Whereas your second special attack is a slide which doesn't work.
It's cross plus circle plus R1 plus rear.
Eaaassy!
Anyway, each level will be interspersed with little film scenes with guys in costume,
who by the way, are filming in a little tiny studio.
It's really so tiny!
Because, they may not have a lot of space to talk, I'm fine with that...
... but no one in the world talks that close.
- Hey, hello! I would like a baguette!
- Yes, what cooking?
- In short, the new story after you recovered the Map of Elements:
your boss then sends you to recover four parts of an amulet
in the water, fire, wind, and earth temples.
Wooow, that is SO original!
Evidently, all the following levels will make you rip your eyes out of your head.
I mean, they inserted platform sequences, with 3D elements in them.
I... I'm in 2D!
We're not even on the same plane of existence!
And this graphical difference, maybe it's hard to tell when you don't actually play,
but it is extremely hard to judge whether the thing you'd like to jump on is in front of you or not.
And...shhhhhhiiiiiittttt!
And every time you die you have to watch
this crappy cinematic with the guy screaming -
SHUT UP!!
What's the deal with this level by the way? At first, it was supposed to be a fucking Shaolin temple!
- Yes, there will undoubtedly need to be some work done.
And finally we reach that section of the test where I can tell you about
the enemy AI.
*kick sound*
which is shiiiiit
We'll face, in turn, the basic enemies
who have been programmed by slinging keyboards at walls...
- Be prepared! I dodgeeeee...
We're the only ones left, Sub-Zero! I parry! I counter!
I cross-uuuuuup...
... then you'll face various bosses: sometimes, they have ultra instinct,
sometimes, the IQ of a stool.
*ominous fight music*
*goofy scream*
Well then, as for the rest, you'll be mostly busy fighting
clones of Baraka. The only exceptions will come far, far after that, more than halfway through the game.
Wait? What? Fighting Mortal Kombat characters?
*chuckles* But what for?
See: wouldn't you rather have giant robots and 3D dinosaurs that spit flames?
Yeah and, by the way: we took out the blood.
And, while you're at it: could you please fuck your mothers too?
I'll admit that, as far as the positioning goes, random enemies who commit suicide,
that's still mildly funny.
Less funny, however, when this prevents you from making progress altogether.

*hit sound*
Ah fuck.!

*hit sound*
Fuck!

*hit sound*
Ah Shit!
Wait... I'll trick him, I'll trick him.
YES! NOOO!
That level is pure hell!
Worst thing is, it's not even the only spot that is like this.
Enemies are drawn by you being there, so that they're always blocking the exits!
MOTHERFUCKING CAMPERS!!
- Wowowow, I have the feeling that the champion of the Earth is a fuming pile of shit,
my dear Shang Tsung.
- Spot on, my dear Raiden.
Indeed, we'll have a view on the replay:
a mild nervous breakdown on the Earth player's part.
We'll take this occasion to acknowledge the work of the medical staff,
currently on screen.
- And due to this pause in the action, we'll have a commercial break.

We're back in our studios...
- Wait, already?
- Yes, of course. Everyone has AdBlock.
- Extraordinary. And then they say that I am the evil overlord here?

- *Grenier* At last!!
- I'm being told there have been some
new developments, the Earth player's problems are settled, play will resume.
- So, I'm not going to do the whole game, mostly because the sewer sequence
- my bad: the "Water Temple" -
is absolutely horrendous: the level takes several hours
on its own to complete, and it is slow...

to the EXTREME...
A succession of mazes
and dull platform sequences...
WHAT'S WRITTEN HERE? WHAT'S WR... IT'S WRITTEN "MORTAL KOMBAT"!!
WHERE'S THE KOMBAT, IN THIS SHIT?
THE ONLY "MORTAL" THING IN YOUR GAME IS THE BOREDOM!!
I mean, just look at the sequences you have to play through in this game sometimes!
*sound of water splashing*
REALTIME
Uhh Fuck..!
I CAN'T BELIEVE IT!
THIS SLOWNESS IS MADDENING! THERE IS LITERALLY
MORE ACTION IN AN EUROPA UNIVERSALIS GAME!
To cut things short: Mortal Kombat Mythologies was an absolute fucking failure.
This should have been the first game in a series
about each character's origin story,
but in the end Sub-Zero will be alone, and after this, nobody will talk about this

EVER!
*horn blowing*
- It is over!
*grunting*
- This is bad...
Huge drawback for Earth,
tenth defeat in a row, I have a feeling that the return of balance

won't be happening tomorrow.
- Wait! WTF? The whole thing is rigged!
That's his game! He's the main character in the game!
HE PLAYS IN IT!
- *mumbling* I dedicate this victory to my wife,
to my newborn son, as well as
my coach, and *unintelligible*
- Champion, the winner of Mortal Kombat is only declared as winner if he lifts the trophy.
Everything's not lost.
Think. Use your head.
- Use my head?...
Use my head! Of course!
*headbutt sound*
*fatality tune*
*horrible scream*
*sinister laugh*
*screams*
- Oh Lord...
... what have you done!?
Ambulance!
Someone call an ambulance!
*sobs*
Raiden! Who's that nutjob you brought with you!?
I invite you to a video game contest, everyone enjoys themselves and all...
AND THAT GUY JUST BLAZES SOMEONE UP!
- But, just to be specific: does this mean I won?...
- Well, technically speaking, yes. But we might be on our way, aren't we?...
- His pupils are dilated!
We're losing him!
I don't give a shit! You'll have to explain yourselves to the cops! I don't give a freaking fuck!
WHERE DO YOU THINK YOU ARE, YOU SICKOS??
- Well...
... in MORTAL KOMBAAAAAAT
HUGE thumbs up to the Musée Robert Tatin
without whom this video would have looked far worse.
A magnificent museum you can see in Cossé-le-Vivien near Laval
